channel.description: General Conference talks by David B. Haight.

item.title: A Foundation Whereon Men Cannot Fall
item.description: I humbly ask an interest in your faith and prayers as I occupy this historic pulpit.

item.title: Planting Gospel Seeds of Spirituality
item.description: The Savior’s powerful promise, “… I will cause that your bosom shall burn within you” (), became a reality to me as I sat in the National Auditorium in Mexico City a few weeks ago and looked out upon the vast throng of 16,000 faithful Saints.

item.title: Power of Evil
item.description: In the brief period that I occupy this pulpit, I pray that my remarks may be in harmony with the spirit of this conference. I acknowledge the divinity of the direction the Church is receiving from President Harold B. Lee, our prophet, and the strengt

item.title: You Are Different
item.description: May I share in the prayers expressed for all of us that I may say some words of encouragement to our youth.

item.title: What Does Jesus Mean to Modern Man?
item.description: This has been a glorious and inspiring day, and I ask for an interest in your faith and prayers that my remarks may be in harmony with the teachings of our Savior.

item.title: Feed the Flock
item.description: I bear witness this day that we have been instructed by an inspired prophet of the Lord. I also know President Kimball loves each of us, and he loves particularly one of your sons whom I met recently in Korea.

item.title: “Why Can’t We?”
item.description: Addressing the Regional Representatives seminar last October, President Kimball stirred our souls with an enlarged perspective of our responsibility as priesthood leaders. He said, “We must do things differently and better!” Several times he issued t

item.title: He Is the Son of God
item.description: I hope you felt of the sweet spirit of this Primary chorus that has blessed this meeting. Did you hear their message? Did you hear what they said?

item.title: Families Are Forever
item.description: The changes in the Church organizational structure presented by President Tanner today and sustained by you are additional evidence of the divine inspiration of the Lord in directing the affairs of His Church. It is inspiring to watch and, when appro

item.title: “We Beheld His Glory”
item.description: He to whom you have just listened, Spencer Woolley Kimball, is God’s prophet to all the world. Not only are the heavens not sealed, as many suppose, but a living prophet is here admonishing and counseling and is available to all who will listen. He i

item.title: Young Women—Real Guardians
item.description: Of all of life’s memorable experiences, there are few to compare with the soul-stirring feeling we have as we hear a missionary express his joy and love for the Lord as he tells of bringing someone to the waters of baptism.

item.title: The Primary Enriches the Lives of Children

item.title: The Stake President’s Role in Welfare Services
item.description: As we discuss the role of Church welfare services in the Lord’s plan for his people, I should like to briefly draw our attention to a most important gospel principle. The Lord has emphasized in many ways the worth of souls: “Remember the worth of sou

item.title: “Feed My Sheep”
item.description: I must admit that my heart beat a little faster with spiritual emotion as the choir was singing “The Morning Breaks; the Shadows Flee,” one of the great, stirring hymns of the Church. You will recall that Parley P. Pratt, one of the Twelve sent to Gr

item.title: Joseph Smith the Prophet
item.description: The eternal truths of the gospel are being accepted by an ever-growing body of believers throughout the world. Our local Church members, working in harmony with our full-time missionaries, are resulting in a rapid expansion of this Church.

item.title: “He Is Not Here. He Is Risen”
item.description: I pray for divine direction and an interest in your faith and prayers as I express the convictions of my soul this morning.

item.title: “The Keys of the Kingdom”
item.description: By divine instruction we assemble semiannually in these great conferences to worship God, our Eternal Father, and declare—through the gift and power of the Holy Ghost—the sonship of Jesus, our Savior and Redeemer, whom to know is to have life eternal

item.title: The Responsibility of Young Aaronic Priesthood Bearers
item.description: Scott Hall is an unusual young man. His father, Garth, is an assistant coach for the Brigham Young University football team.

item.title: People to People
item.description: Arturo Toscanini, the late, famous conductor of the New York Philharmonic Orchestra, received a brief, crumpled letter from a lonely sheepherder in the remote mountain area of Wyoming:

item.title: Jesus Is Our Savior
item.description: I’m going to ask you to pause for a moment and recall the feeling that you just had as you stood and joined in the singing of “We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet” ( no. 196), as you looked upon our living prophet.

item.title: Love All
item.description: I pray for a heavenly blessing as I stand at this historic pulpit to give expression to direction received for this conference.

item.title: The Sacrament
item.description: I wish everyone could grow up in a small town. I have so many happy memories of my boyhood. During those delightful summer and winter evenings we created most of our own activities and amusement. They were wonderful days.

item.title: Become a Star Thrower
item.description: I rejoice with each of you priesthood holders, assembled in hundreds of meetinghouses throughout the world, in the knowledge that what is said here tonight is in harmony with and will assist in hastening the fulfillment of ancient and modern prophecy

item.title: Marriage and Divorce
item.description: I pray for the companionship of the Holy Spirit, that my remarks will be in harmony with revealed truth and will be received and understood by that same heavenly influence.

item.title: Personal Morality
item.description: Recently new temples were dedicated in Sydney, Australia, and in the Philippines.

item.title: The Resurrected Christ
item.description: On this glorious Easter morning, I rejoice with you and untold millions of people throughout the world whose hearts are turned to Jesus of Nazareth. To the Samaritan woman at Jacob’s Well who said, “I know that Messias cometh … : when he is come, he

item.title: A Prophet Chosen of the Lord
item.description: My dear brethren and sisters, I rejoice with you in being present this morning to hear the voice of our prophet, President Ezra Taft Benson, and to feel of his spirit and loving concern for all of mankind as he has counseled the Church and the people

item.title: Spiritual Crevasses
item.description: What a stirring sight to look upon this vast audience of men and boys! I can visualize grandfathers, fathers, bishops, deacons, teachers, and priests seated together, some as families or quorums; also full-time missionaries, students, and new convert

item.title: My Neighbor—My Brother!
item.description: Jesus was once asked a provocative question by a lawyer: “Who is my neighbour?” (). Indeed, that is a question we all should ask—“Who is my neighbor?”

item.title: Ethics and Honesty
item.description: I have prayed for an interest in your faith and prayers, that I might say clearly what is in my heart.

item.title: Our Lord and Savior
item.description: I have prayed for the blessings of heaven to be upon my efforts in speaking to you today.

item.title: A Call to Serve
item.description: As we all stood a few moments ago and joined in singing “The Spirit of God like a fire is burning” ( 1985, no. 2), I could visualize that beautiful little temple in Kirtland, Ohio, built by valiant Saints during their poverty and relentless persecuti

item.title: The Sacrament—and the Sacrifice
item.description: I pray for your faith and prayers that my utterances will be received and understood “by the Spirit of truth” and that my expressions will be given “by the Spirit of truth” so that we might all be “edified and rejoice together.” (See .)

item.title: Filling the Whole Earth
item.description: We have just had the privilege of sustaining, with our uplifted hands and deep affection, Ezra Taft Benson as God’s living prophet, his inspired counselors, and members of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles as prophets, seers, and revelators, and the

item.title: Temples and Work Therein
item.description: Temples are the most sacred places of worship on earth where sacred ordinances are performed—ordinances which pertain to salvation and exaltation in the kingdom of God. Each one is literally a house of the Lord—a place where He and His spirit may dwe

item.title: Linking the Family of Man
item.description: Yesterday, April the 6th, as we have been reminded today, marked the 161st anniversary of the reestablishment of our Lord’s church in these latter days. The history of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is also a history of the dispensat

item.title: A Time for Preparation
item.description: I thank the Lord for this wonderful opportunity to be with you here tonight, you who hold the priesthood. I pray that my words will be appropriate, clearly heard, and understood.

item.title: Come to the House of the Lord
item.description: In the first recorded revelation of this, the last dispensation, our Lord instructed Joseph Smith in what we regard as perhaps the greatest work of this dispensation: to seal the living to their families and progenitors. (See .)

item.title: Successful Living of Gospel Principles
item.description: Forever, I will gratefully acknowledge our Lord’s blessings to me, which I do again at this time.

item.title: Personal Temple Worship
item.description: I rejoice with each of you as we have joined in the sustaining of our Church leaders. We welcome Brother Neil Andersen and Todd Christofferson as new General Authorities. Our hearts are filled with gratitude for the continuing growth of the Church as

item.title: Missionary Work—Our Responsibility
item.description: I have prayed that the blessings of heaven will direct my expressions this morning that I might convey to you the desires of my soul.

item.title: Jesus of Nazareth
item.description: I pray for a portion of your faith and prayers as I bear witness of Christ. In the hearts of all mankind, of whatever race or station in life, there are inexpressible longings for something they do not now possess. This longing is implanted by a conc

item.title: Solemn Assemblies
item.description: From the depths of my soul, I have prayed for the direction and influence of the Holy Ghost on this heaven-directed occasion. The proceedings have been most impressive as a new chapter of Church history begins.

item.title: Sustaining a New Prophet
item.description: My brothers and sisters, this has been a historic and blessed day. As I have witnessed the inspired manner in which President Gordon B. Hinckley fulfilled his calling as a counselor to Presidents Spencer W. Kimball, Ezra Taft Benson, and finally to H

item.title: Seek First the Kingdom of God
item.description: As some of us get older, we slow down, so you’ll have to tolerate us a little. I thank the Lord for his blessings to me and that I am able to attend this conference and hear what we have heard so far. This is a momentous period in our Church history.

item.title: This Work Is True
item.description: I hope you had a burning in your heart and a quickening of your soul as you heard those statistics regarding the growth of the Church. Today is the anniversary of the organization of the Church 166 years ago today in the Peter Whitmer farmhouse in Fa

item.title: Prophets Are Inspired
item.description: I’m honored to be here, to be part of this great conference. I’m glad that the First Presidency saw fit to have me back on the program. As we get older we have some limitations. I understand mine, and sometimes we can learn to sort of plow around the

item.title: The Basics Have Not Changed
item.description: Learn to be … obedient above all things—that you might be able to carry out the Lord’s work in the majestic way in which it must be done.

item.title: Hymn of the Obedient: “All Is Well”
item.description: What a wonderful future we have for the Church. All of these things are dependent upon how we accept the truth, how we live the principles of the gospel.

item.title: Live the Commandments
item.description: Take advantage of this great opportunity in your life to live it well, to be good, to have good works, and to influence other people for good.

item.title: Sustaining the Prophets
item.description: The gospel is true; it is the hope of the world; it will move onward to accomplish all that it must do.

item.title: Love and Service
item.description: Let me just remind all of you of the great need we have … for couple missionaries. … If you’re retired and wondering what to do with those extra years, there’s a world out there of excitement.

item.title: Faith, Devotion, and Gratitude
item.description: I hope that we have grateful hearts for the knowledge that we have and the testimonies we have and for the feelings we have.

item.title: Be a Strong Link
item.description: As my eyesight dims somewhat, I think my vision improves—my vision of the long road, my vision of what lies ahead.

item.title: Gratitude and Service
item.description: May you have a burning feeling in your heart. May you feel as I do on this day that this work is true and that it is meant for us to help bring about the eternal plan of salvation and exaltation.

item.title: Faith of Our Prophets
item.description: What we need is the faith of Brigham Young and the faith of Gordon B. Hinckley and the faith of people who are our prophets and leaders.

item.title: Were There Not Ten Cleansed?
item.description: If we’re ever going to show gratitude properly to our Heavenly Father, we should do it with all of our heart, might, mind, and strength.

item.title: Growing into the Priesthood
item.description: Priesthood is the power and authority delegated to man by our Heavenly Father. The authority and majesty of it are beyond our comprehension.

item.title: How Great the Wisdom and the Love
item.description: The gospel is true. I know it; I’m a witness of it.
